pr_title: KEYCLOAK-14767 OpenShift Review Endpoint audience fix

timeline.message: KEYCLOAK-14767 OpenShift Review Endpoint audience fix

timeline.bodyText: Why to remove this test? Is it not valid anymore?
timeline.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: Yes, this is not valid anymore. If you remove all the scopes, you won't get any audience in the token. So with adding audience to the Token Retrospection Endpoint, this has no sense anymore.
replies.author: slaskawi

timeline.bodyText:
Is this really invoked without audience? I can see it added here:

  
    
      keycloak/testsuite/integration-arquillian/tests/base/src/test/java/org/keycloak/testsuite/openshift/OpenShiftTokenReviewEndpointTest.java
    
    
         Line 379
      in
      39b05b4
    
    
    
    

        
          
           spec.setAudiences(new String[]{"account"}); 
        
    
  


But maybe I'm just missing something. :)
timeline.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: It's the other way around. The account audience is being added to the expected audience. The Token itself will have empty audience emitted from the Token Endpoint.
replies.author: slaskawi

timeline.bodyText: Just a silly question. For some reason, originally it was prohibited for expectedAudience to be null. Why to allow it now? And are we 100% sure this doesn't create e.g. some vulnerability?
timeline.author: vmuzikar

replies.author: slaskawi
